description.narrative: The World Disasters Report (WDR) 2009 will focus on early warning systems and early responses to disasters. It will focus on the vital importance of early warning systems (short- and long-term), at global, regional, national and community levels – i.e., from the highly sophisticated satellite systems through to the use of megaphones and radio in small villages, and early action. This report will provide sound and current information on early warning systems and the important components of the early warning ‘chain’ – information about risks of hazards, technical monitoring and warning services, communication and dissemination of warnings, a capable and effective community response. However, although early warning systems are well advanced in some countries, in others there are major gaps and shortcomings. The report will describe the major challenges to successful early warning.
